stimulus:
In this study, you will read text scenarios and make slider judgments about the situations which they describe. Here is an image of an example trial.


In the upcoming trials, please read the descriptions and give your answer by clicking on the slider. Please read each scenario description carefully, but we are interested in your intuitive judgment so no need to second-guess yourself.

You must make a slider judgment in each trial. You will not receive any feedback.


When you are ready to begin, press the start button.

Sarah excitedly talks about a recent indie band concert she attended with her friend Mark.
Sarah: "I'm so happy I was able to hear them live. I loved every moment!"
Mark: "I thought it was boring. I struggled getting into the music."

How boring was the concert for Mark?

Anna tells her professor that she needs a few extra days to complete an assignment due to family obligations.
Anna: "I'm really sorry, but could I have an extension on the assignment? I had a family emergency."
Professor: "That's quite understandable, Anna. Take the extra time you need."

How understandable does the Professor think Anna's reasons are?

Sarah is interning at a company, and her boss, Mr. Thompson asks her if she can stay to finish up her report.
Mr. Thompson: "Could you stay late today to help finish up the report?"
Sarah: "I'm feeling exhausted after the back-to-back meetings today, so I'm not sure I'd be at my best. Would it be alright if come in early tomorrow instead to finish it up?"

How tired is Sarah?

Jo's manager shares their thoughts on a recent company webinar.
Manager: "The webinar on productivity strategies was so enlightening."
Jo: "I thought it was boring. The content didn't really resonate with me."

How boring was the webinar for Jo?

Emma invites her friend Alex over for dinner and cooks a homemade meal.
Emma: "I wasn't sure if you'd like it. I tried a new recipe."
Alex: "It's quite good! I think the flavors really come together nicely."

How good did Alex think Emma's cooking was?

Lisa meets with her child's teacher to discuss declining grades.
Lisa: "I noticed my son's grades have dropped significantly, and I'm concerned about how this might affect his future."

How concerned is Lisa?

Emma's friend, Sarah, needs to cancel their dinner plans because she has a work emergency.
Sarah: "I'm really sorry, but I have to stay late at work tonight. I won't be able to make it to dinner."
Emma: "That's understandable. Work comes first. We can always reschedule."

How understandable does Emma think Sarah's reasons are?

Amy's boyfriend Jake wants to talk her about their date this weekend, but Amy is tired.
Jake: "Hey Amy, can we talk about this weekend?"
Amy: "I'm exhausted right now. Would it be okay if we talk about it tomorrow instead?"

How tired is Amy?

Alex is attending a lecture, but a group of students nearby is talking loudly, making it hard to hear the professor.
Alex (to the students): "It's difficult to listen to the lecture with all the talking. Could you keep it down please?"

How difficult is it for Alex to listen to the lecture?

Amy is trying to study in her room, but her roommate, Jake, is playing music loudly in the living room.
Amy: "Hey Jake, it's difficult to concentrate with the music so loud. Do you think you could turn it down a bit?"

How difficult is it for Amy to concentrate?

After a trip to an art museum, Emily talks about her favorite exhibits with David.
Emily: "The contemporary art section was fascinating! I could spend hours there!"
David: "I actually thought it was a bit boring. I didn't really understand the art."

How boring were the exhibits for David?

Rachel notices that her friend has been looking stressed and overwhelmed.
Rachel: "You've been really busy with work lately. It's making me pretty concerned about how you're handling everything."

How concerned is Rachel?

Rachel notices that her friend has been looking stressed and overwhelmed.
Rachel: "You've been really busy with work lately. It's making me concerned about how you're handling everything."

How concerned is Rachel?

After watching a slow-paced romantic drama, Lisa shares her thoughts with Jake.
Lisa: "I thought that movie was so beautiful! The emotions were just perfect."
Jake: "Honestly for me, it was pretty boring. I was hoping for more action."

How boring was the drama for Jake?

Melissa's colleague shares their positive experience at a networking event.
Colleague: "I enjoyed the event and made some great connections."
Melissa: "Honestly, I found the event quite boring. I struggled to find conversations that interested me."

How boring was the networking event for Melissa?

After a trip to an art museum, Emily talks about her favorite exhibits with David.
Emily: "The contemporary art section was fascinating! I could spend hours there!"
David: "I actually thought it was boring. I didn't really understand the art."

How boring were the exhibits for David?

Emma invites her friend Alex over for dinner and cooks a homemade meal.
Emma: "I wasn't sure if you'd like it. I tried a new recipe."
Alex: "It's good! I think the flavors really come together nicely."

How good did Alex think Emma's cooking was?

During a coffee break, Mike notices their colleague looking overwhelmed.
Mike: "You seem really swamped with work lately. I'm concerned that you might be taking on too much."

How concerned is Mike?

Lisa meets with her child's teacher to discuss declining grades.
Lisa: "I noticed my son's grades have dropped significantly, and I'm quite concerned about how this might affect his future."

How concerned is Lisa?

Chris's friend Emma asks Chris if he wants to join her on a weekend trip.
Emma: "We're planning a spontaneous road trip this weekend. Want to join?"
Chris: "That sounds awesome, but I'm exhausted from traveling all week. I think I need some downtime instead."

How tired is Chris?

Claire is studying for an exam, but her younger siblings are playing noisily in the next room.
Claire: "It's pretty difficult to study with all the noise. Can you please be a bit quieter?"

How difficult is it for Claire to study?

Sophie asks Daniel if he can call later tonight.
Sophie: "Can I call you to chat later tonight? I could use some advice."
Daniel: "I'd love to help, but I'm pretty exhausted and might fall asleep. Can we talk tomorrow?"

How tired is Daniel?

Jane reads a fantasy novel, a genre she doesn't usually enjoy, because a friend recommended it.
Friend: "So, what did you think?"
Jane: "It was kind of good. The world-building was more interesting than I expected."

How good did Jane think the novel was?

Amy's boyfriend Jake wants to talk her about their date this weekend, but Amy is tired.
Jake: "Hey Amy, can we talk about this weekend?"
Amy: "I'm kind of exhausted right now. Would it be okay if we talk about it tomorrow instead?"

How tired is Amy?

Ms. Johnson hands back graded essays to her student and gives feedback.
Ms. Johnson: "Your essay was good. Well done."

How good did Ms. Johnson think the student's essay was?

After watching a slow-paced romantic drama, Lisa shares her thoughts with Jake.
Lisa: "I thought that movie was so beautiful! The emotions were just perfect."
Jake: "Honestly for me, it was boring. I was hoping for more action."

How boring was the drama for Jake?

During a class discussion, Emily expresses concerns about a peer.
Emily: "I'm slightly concerned about Jake; he hasn't been participating in class and seems really withdrawn."

How concerned is Emily?

Jo's manager shares their thoughts on a recent company webinar.
Manager: "The webinar on productivity strategies was so enlightening."
Jo: "I thought it was slightly boring. The content didn't really resonate with me."

How boring was the webinar for Jo?

How tired is Chris?

Ben's cousin Amy asks him if he's coming to their monthly family gathering.
Amy: "Are you coming to the family dinner this evening?"
Ben: "I'd love to, but I'm quite exhausted from work this week. I'll catch up with everyone next time."

How tired is Ben?

How difficult is it for Amy to concentrate?

David observes that his colleague has been distant.
David: "I've noticed you haven't been as chatty as usual, and am concerned. Is everything okay at home?"

How concerned is David?

John invites his friend Alex to a weekend camping trip, but Alex declines.
Alex: "I'd love to go, but I think I need some rest this weekend."
John: "That's understandable. You've been taking on a lot recently. I can ask you later in the year when you have more time."

How understandable does John think Alex's reasons are?

Sarah is at a restaurant with friends, but the background music is too loud to have a conversation.
Sarah (to the waiter): "It's quite difficult to talk with the music this loud. Could you ask the staff to turn it down a little?"

How difficult is it for Sarah to talk?
